sen.j: 結城 氏朝（ゆうき うじとも、生没年不詳）は、白河結城氏第6代当主。
sen.e: Ujitomo YUKI was the sixth head of the Shirakawa Yuki clan, whose birth & death year is unknown.
Ujitomo YUKI (year of birth and death unknown) was the sixth head of the Shirakawa Yuki.
sen.cmt: Better to put the information about birth and death in brackets.
sen.e: Ujitomo YUKI (year of birth and death unknown) was the sixth head of the Shirakawa Yuki clan.

sen.j: 第5代当主結城満朝の養子で実父は那須資朝（上那須氏当主那須資之の子）。
sen.e: Ujitomo was adopted by Mitsutomo YUKI, the fifth head of the clan, and Ujitomo's real father was Suketomo NASU, the son of Sukeyuki NASU (the head of the Kaminasu clan).
Ujitomo was adopted by Mitsutomo YUKI, the fifth head of the clan, his real father being Suketomo NASU, the son of Sukeyuki NASU (the head of the Kaminasu clan).
Ujitomo was adopted by Mitsutomo YUKI, the fifth head of the clan, his real father being Suketomo NASU, the son of Sukeyuki NASU (the head of the Kaminasu clan).

sen.j: 第7代当主結城直朝の養父。
sen.e: Ujitomo was the adoptive father of the seventh head Naotomo YUKI.
Ujitomo was the adoptive father of the seventh head, Naotomo YUKI.
Ujitomo was the adoptive father of the seventh head, Naotomo YUKI.

sen.j: 結城満朝の養子となり白河結城氏を継いだ。
sen.e: Ujitomo succeeded to the the Shirakawa Yuki clan as an adopted child of Mitsutomo YUKI.
As the adopted child of Mitsutomo YUKI, Ujitomo became head of the Shirakawa Yuki clan.
sen.cmt: I think the sentence in more natural in this order.
sen.e: As the adopted child of Mitsutomo YUKI, Ujitomo became head of the Shirakawa Yuki clan.

sen.j: 京都扶持衆になるなど室町幕府に近い人物であった。
sen.e: Ujitomo was close to the Muromachi shogunate, which was shown by his becoming "Kyoto Fuchishu" (the samurai placed as the direct vassal of the Ashikaga shogunate).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Ujitomo was close to the Muromachi shogunate, as shown by his becoming "Kyoto Fuchishu" (the samurai placed in Kyoto as the direct vassal of the Ashikaga shogunate).
sen.cmt: Natural English. Also added "in Kyoto" to clarify the explanation of "Kyoto Fuchisu".
sen.e: Ujitomo was close to the Muromachi shogunate, as shown by his becoming "Kyoto Fuchishu" (the samurai placed in Kanto region as the direct vassal of the Ashikaga shogunate).
sen.cmt: 「京都扶持衆」は、（京都ではなく）関東に置かれた武士であるため、"placed in Kanto region" としました。

sen.j: それゆえ永享の乱においては上杉憲実に味方し鎌倉公方足利持氏と敵対した。
sen.e: So Ujitomo sided with Norizane UESUGI in the Eikyo War, opposing Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, the then "Kamakura-kubo" (Governor-general of the Kanto region).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Consequently, Ujitomo sided with Norizane UESUGI in the Eikyo War, opposing Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, the then "Kamakura-kubo" (Governor-general of the Kanto region).
sen.cmt: I think "consequently" works better than "so" at the beginning of the sentence here.
sen.e: Consequently, Ujitomo sided with Norizane UESUGI in the Eikyo War, opposing Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, the then "Kamakura-kubo" (Governor-general of the Kanto region).

sen.j: 後継には小峰氏から養子として結城直朝 (白河氏)を迎えている。
sen.e: Ujitomo adopted a boy of the Komine clan and appointed him to the heir, who is called Naotomo YUKI.
Ujitomo adopted a boy by the name of Naomoto from the Komine clan and appointed him as heir.
sen.cmt: I simplified this sentence a little bit.
sen.e: Ujitomo adopted a boy by the name of Naotomo YUKI from the Komine clan and appointed him as heir.
sen.cmt: YUKI を追加しました。スペルを修正しました。
